PDFCanvas.description: The core component for rendering the PDF and overlaying fields.
PDFCanvas.tech: react-pdf (for rendering) + absolute positioned divs (for fields)
PDFCanvas.interaction: useDraggable (dnd-kit or react-draggable) for field placement.

login_background.usage: Full screen background for login/auth pages with a white glassmorphism card overlay.

empty_state.usage: Displayed when no templates exist in the dashboard.

rules: Ensure 4.5:1 contrast ratio for all text.
All interactive elements must have :focus-visible styles.
All inputs must have associated labels.
accessibility.testing: All interactive elements MUST include a `data-testid` attribute (e.g., `data-testid='submit-button'`).

universal_guidelines: DO NOT use gradients for backgrounds. Use solid colors or subtle noise textures.
Avoid 'center-everything'. Use left alignment for text to improve readability.
Use 2x more whitespace than you think is necessary.
Inputs and buttons should feel 'tactile' - use subtle borders and shadows.
Error messages should be helpful and human, not robotic (e.g., 'Please enter a valid date' instead of 'Invalid Input').
For the PDF Canvas: Ensure the 'overlay' layer exactly matches the PDF dimensions. Use CSS 'transform: scale()' to handle zoom without breaking layout.
instructions_to_main_agent: You are building a precision tool. The 'Template Builder' is the heart of the app. Focus on the 'Drag and Drop' experience. It must feel smooth. Use 'react-draggable' or '@dnd-kit/core' for the field movement. The coordinate system is critical: (0,0) is usually bottom-left in PDF, but top-left in CSS. You MUST handle this conversion logic in the frontend. Use 'pdf-lib' for the actual PDF generation logic in the backend or frontend service layer.
